meanings.definition: A blank page at the beginning or end of a book.
meanings.sent1: The flyleaf in the book was the perfect spot for me to write my name.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy the beautiful illustrations on the flyleaf of my favorite novels.
meanings.sent3: The flyleaf in the book seemed to be waiting for a story to be written on it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a flyleaf, ready to be filled with new adventures and knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The flyleaf fluttered gently as the book was opened, revealing a world of possibilities.

meanings.definition: The leaf of a plant that is specialized for trapping insects.
meanings.sent1: The Venus flytrap is a famous plant known for its flyleaf that catches insects.
meanings.sent2: The flyleaf of the pitcher plant is designed to lure and capture unsuspecting insects.
meanings.sent3: The flyleaf of the carnivorous plant was like a sneaky trap for bugs.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the flyleaf of the sundew plant sparkled with dew, ready to catch its prey.
meanings.sent5: The flyleaf of the insect-eating plant was like a sticky hand grabbing any bug that landed on it.
